paragraphs.text: 2015: Beyond Obama, new Congress, we need a revival of the American spirit.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: In the film, "Girl Interrupted," Winona Ryder plays an 18-year-old who enters a mental institution for what is diagnosed as borderline personality disorder
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The year is 1967
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the country is in turmoil over Vietnam and civil rights
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: While lying on her bed one night and watching TV, she sees a news report about a demonstration
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The narrator says something that might apply to today's turmoil:"We live in a time of doubt. The institutions we once trusted no longer seem reliable."
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: As 2014 ends,
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the stock market is at record highs
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: our traditional institutions and self-confidence are in decline
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A Pew Research Center study confirms one trend that has been obvious over several years
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The "typical" American family is no longer typical
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Just 46 percent of American children now live in homes with their married, heterosexual parents
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Five percent have no parents at home
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: They most likely are living with grandparents, says the study
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: These startling figures about the decline of the American family contrast with the year 1960
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when 73 percent of American children lived in traditional families
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: A major contributor to this trend has been the assault on marriage and other institutions by the Baby Boom generation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It was that generation that promoted cohabitation, no-fault divorce, hatred of the police(they called them "pigs" then, too) and disdain for the military and America, spawned not just by the Vietnam War but a life of relative ease unknown to their parents
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The culture bomb dropped by the boomers created fallout still being felt today
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The two-plus generations born since the Sixties have been infused with the notion of entitlement, victimhood, envy and greed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Since the elimination of the draft, young people are no longer expected to serve in the military and so most of them pursue whatever goals they wish with no expectation they should give something back to their country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's one possible explanation for why we can no longer seem to win wars
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: History warns us what happens when empires refuse to teach known values that strengthen societies and help protect them from enemies intent on their destruction
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: The late British diplomat Sir John Glubb wrote a book called "The Fate of Empires and Search For Survival."
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Glubb noted the average age of empires since the time of ancient Assyria (859-612 B.C ) is 250 years
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Only the Mameluke Empire in Egypt and the Levant (1250-1517) made it as far as 267 years
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: America is 238 years old and is exhibiting signs of decline
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: All empires begin, writes Glubb, with the age of pioneers, followed by ages of conquest, commerce, affluence, intellect and decadence
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: America appears to have reached the age of decadence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which Glubb defines as marked by "defensiveness, pessimism, materialism, frivolity, an influx of foreigners, the welfare state, (and) a weakening of religion."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Decadence, he writes,"is due to: Too long a period of wealth and power, selfishness, love of money (and) the loss of a sense of duty."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Do these not define America at the end of 2014?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Glubb says the 250-year average of empires has not varied in 3,000 years
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we don' t learn from history because"our studies are brief and prejudiced."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: He means they are mostly about one's own country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It will take more than a new Congress in 2015 and a new president in 2017 to save us from the fate of other empires
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It will take a revival of the American spirit
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that can only come through changed attitudes towards our institutions and each other
paragraphs.label: assumption
